= Optional Vendor Libraries Setup
:toc:

This project optionally depends on two vendor libraries:

- **FTD2XX** (v2.12.36.20)
- **libMPSSE** (v1.0.8)

Users building components that require these libraries must install them
locally. The project itself does **not include these libraries**.

You can make CMake find them using `CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH`.

Copy the cmake config files provided here to the respective library locations to make them available for cmake.

== 1. Installing FTD2XX (v2.12.36.20)

1. Build or obtain the library (`ftd2xx.lib` and `ftd2xx.h`).

2. Choose an install prefix, e.g.:

	C:\vendorlibs\ftd2xx-2.12.36.20\

3. Organize files like:

	C:\vendorlibs\ftd2xx-2.12.36.20
	├── include
	│	└── ftd2xx.h
	├── lib
	│	└── ftd2xx.lib
	├── FTD2XXConfig.cmake
	└── FTD2XXConfigVersion.cmake

== 2. Installing libMPSSE (v1.0.8)

1. Build or obtain `libmpsse.lib` and headers (`libmpsse_spi.h`, `libmpsse_i2c.h`).

2. Choose a prefix:

	C:\vendorlibs\mpsse-1.0.8\

3. Organize files:

	C:\vendorlibs\mpsse-1.0.8
	├── include
	│	├── libmpsse_spi.h
	│	└── libmpsse_i2c.h
	├── lib
	│	└── libmpsse.lib
	├── MPSSEConfig.cmake
	└── MPSSEConfigVersion.cmake

**Note:** libMPSSE depends on FTD2XX. Make sure FTD2XX is available first.

== 3. Using the libraries in CMake

Set your environment variable DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH to contain the prefixes (the paths to your library folders), separated by semicolon, for example:

```bash
DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="C:/vendorlibs/ftd2xx-2.12.36.20;C:/vendorlibs/mpsse-1.0.8" ..
```
